title: KDP Niche Research - How to Find Low Content Book Niches on Amazon for FREE in 2021 (NO PAID TOOLS!)

tactics.name: Amazon Search + Customer Bought
tactics.description: Use Amazon's search to find independently published books with high review counts, then leverage 'Customers who bought this item also bought' to discover related niches.
steps: Search for a starting niche (e.g., 'logbook notebook')
Filter independently published books with >2000 reviews
Scroll to 'Customers who bought this item also bought' section
Add low-content book ideas from top-selling related items
caveats: May miss niche overlap if starting point is too broad
source_quotes: 'the first book that you find when using this method is to make sure that this book is popular'

tactics.name: Amazon Cross-Sell Analysis
tactics.description: Use 'Customers who bought this item also bought' to identify related niches
steps: Check independently published books in 'Also bought' sections
Filter out sponsored listings and focus on rankings
Prioritize books with low review counts but strong rankings
caveats: May fail if niche has excessive competition
source_quotes: if someone's looking for a meal planner and they haven't bought this one it probably means they're just going to be looking for other meal planners

heuristics.name: Review Count Filter
source_quotes: 'the first book that you find when using this method is to make sure that this book is popular'

heuristics.name: Ranking Density Check
heuristics.condition: If multiple books in a niche are ranked under 100,000, the niche is viable
source_quotes: if you can find like four or five that are ranked say below 100 000 then your niche is golden

claims.statement: Organic Amazon traffic can drive sales without ad spend
source_quotes: 'these are all paid for orders as well and the great thing... none of these sales here are driven by ad spend'

claims.statement: Low review count books can succeed if niche demand is strong
source_quotes: if someone's willing to buy a book with a cover that isn't particularly um then it's a really good sign that the niche is very very strong

niche_patterns.description: Combine a core identity (logbook) with a functional problem (tracking) and a constraint (low-content format) to identify underserved niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages existing demand while exploiting content gaps in niche markets
source_quotes: 'the first book that you find when using this method is to make sure that this book is popular'
